lines.text: You're acting like a child.
Well, a great man is one who in manhood still keeps the heart of a child.
00. I hate the way you kill real feelings. I hate everything that you stand for. Most of all, I hate rich kids and I hate this place. So why do I want to fuck you so bad?
I'm no Italian. I'm a Polack. And I can't be bought.
[last lines]
You were right; I'm was wrong. Sorry. I'd like to be a nice guy. I would. I just don't know how to be nice.
You're really cracked. You know that?
[kisses Stanley]
[first lines]
Captain McKenna, any leads in the murder of Jackie Wong?
Nothing at this time.
Do you think this killing means there's some kind of war going on in the Chinatown Tongs?
No, I don't. This is basically a situation where the youth gangs are lashing out at the establishment. The community is cooperating. The situation's under control.
I die, I'm fucked. My family's fucked.
A fish stinks from the head down.
The Chinese eat the head.
Dollars are like small fish, difficult to catch, but not to be thrown back except as bait for something bigger.
I think you upset him.
I certainly hope so.
You care too much, Stanley.
How can anybody care too much?
